Package ec.app.experiments.WaveletExperiment.wavelets

Class HaarFilter

java.lang.Object
ec.app.experiments.WaveletExperiment.wavelets.HaarFilter
public class HaarFilter extends Object

Instances of this class provide methods for applying a Haar wavelet filter to two dimensional values stored in a byte array. It is primarily intended to be used for image processing. It also provides methods for reversing the filter and converting filters and data into images.

Applying a filter to a byte array containing values in the range [0-255] results in a same length integer array that contains the filter values; as per the parameters set on the HaarFilter instance. A fractional integer encoding is used for reasons of performance; it also ensures that filters constructed with a sufficient number of fractional bits can be inverted perfectly. As a consequence of the current implementation of this encoding by this class, there is an upper limit to the size of value array that can be filtered - presently 4096x4096.

Filtering can only be performed on data arrays that have a size which is a square of a power of two. At present, the class only supports non-standard basis functions. NOTE: This implementation has not been heavily tested and may contain any number of bugs or inadequacies, see NOTES in the source for further information.

Author:
Tom Gibara

  • Constructor Details

    • HaarFilter

      public HaarFilter(int size)
      Constructs a new object for performing filtering. Individual filtering instances are constructed to operate on data of a predetermined size. All arrays passed to a filter must have a length which corresponds to the size specified at construction (specifically size x size).
      Parameters:
      size - the length of the side of all squares of data/filter values

    • HaarFilter

      public HaarFilter(int size, int iterations, int fractionalBits)
      Constructs a new object for performing filtering. Individual filtering instances are constructed to operate on data of a predetermined size. All arrays passed to a filter must have a length which corresponds to the size specified at construction (specifically size x size). See
      Parameters:
      size - the length of the side of all squares of data/filter values
      iterations - the number of iterations performed during filtering, or -1 to use the default value
      fractionalBits - the number of binary fractional bits in the number representation used in filters, or -1 to use the default value
      See Also:
      • for information about the iterations parameter
      • for information about the fractionalBits parameter

  • Method Details

    • getIterations

      public int getIterations()
      The number of iterations that will be applied during a call to the filter method.
      Returns:
      the number of iterations performed during filtering, never negative
      See Also:
      • for more information

    • getFractionalBits

      public int getFractionalBits()
      The number of fractional bits that will be used in the filtered values returned by the filter method.
      Returns:
      the number of binary fractional bits in the number representation used in filters, never negative
      See Also:
      • for more information

    • setIterations

      public void setIterations(int iterations)
      Specifies the number of times that the Haar wavelet is successively applied during a call to the filter method. This cannot exceed ln2(size). This maximum forms the sensible default value and can be specified by passing a negative number to this method.
      Parameters:
      the - number of iterations performed during filtering, or -1 for the default value

    • setFractionalBits

      public void setFractionalBits(int fractionalBits)
      Specifies the number of bits in the integers returned by the filter method that represent fractions of a whole number. If fractionalBits is not zero, these bits will form the least significant bits of the integers. Due to the size constraints that arise from arithmetic on ints the number of fractional bits cannot exceed 23. The sensible default value for the number of fractional bits is twice the number of iterations; this default can be specified by passing a negative number to this method.
      Parameters:
      fractionalBits - the number of binary fractional bits in the number representation used in filters, or -1 for the default value

    • filter

      public int[] filter(byte[] values, int[] filter)
      Filters the byte values supplied by applying the Haar wavelet for a number of iterations and stores the result in the specified integer array. If no filter array is supplied then a new array is created. The values returned may have been scaled to accomodate fractional bits.
      Parameters:
      values - a byte array of length containing the values to be filtered, not null
      filter - an array which is to contain the filter values, or null
      Returns:
      the array which contains the filter values

    • invert

      public byte[] invert(int[] filter, byte[] values)
      Converts a filter created by this object back into the supplied byte array. If no byte array is supplied a new one is created. If the iterations and fractionalBits parameters of this object have been modified since the filter was created then the data will not be faithfully reconstructed. If the number of fractional bits is less than its default value then the inversion may be imperfect due to accumulated rounding errors. This method destroys the supplied filter array - this is done intentionally for performance reasons. If you want to preserve your filter clone it before passing it into this method.
      Parameters:
      filter - an array containing the filter values, not null
      values - an array which is to contain the recovered data, or null
      Returns:
      the array which contains the recovered data

    • filterToImage

      public BufferedImage filterToImage(int[] filter)
      A utility method for converting filter values generated by this object into an TYPE_BYTE_GRAY BufferedImage. If the fractionalBits parameter of this object has been modified since the filter was created then the image may not be accurately generated.
      Parameters:
      filter - an array containing the filter values, not null
      Returns:
      the generated image

    • valuesToImage

      public BufferedImage valuesToImage(byte[] values)
      A utility method for converting data values into an TYPE_BYTE_GRAY BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      values - an array containing the data values, not null
      Returns:
      the generated image
